import operator
from functools import reduce

from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.constants import STREAM_INFO_TEXT
from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.base.models.openai_constants import MODEL_NAMES
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    MessageInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"

    inputs = [
        MessageInput(name="input_value", display_name="Input"),
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name", display_name="Model Name", advanced=False, options=MODEL_NAMES, value=MODEL_NAMES[0]
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="openai_api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        BoolInput(name="stream", display_name="Stream", info=STREAM_INFO_TEXT, advanced=True),
        StrInput(
            name="system_message",
            display_name="System Message",
            info="System message to pass to the model.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schea is a list of dictionarie s
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.openai_api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed
        model_kwargs["seed"] = seed

        if openai_api_key:
            api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key)
        else:
            api_key = None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature or 0.1,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})  # type: ignore

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return

from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def post_code_processing(self, new_build_config: dict, current_build_config: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_build_config, current_build_config)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_build_config
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(frontend_template=frontend_node, raw_template=current_build_config["template"])
        return frontend_node

Your job is to create python code that can be executed to create a presentation that will contain the appropriate data. Check the code below and fix to make sure that it will create a proper powerpoint presentation. Make sure that each epic is in its own slide, with the relevant user stories as the content. Remove any unnecessary lines in strings. If a part of the string is wrapped  in '**', remove the '**'. If a string has a bullet point included, remove the bullet point. Do not change the slide layouts.


from pptx import Presentation
from pptx.util import Inches
import os

# Add the list of epics for the discovery phase
presentation_name = {presentation_name}
conclusion_content = {conclusion_content}
epics = {epics}

#Next steps array
next_steps = {NextSteps}

#Credits
credits = "{credits}"

# Create a presentation object
prs = Presentation(r"C:\\Users\\sarim\\Desktop\\Globant\\PPTEST\\Themes\\GlobantTheme.pptx")


# Add a title slide
title_slide_layout = prs.slide_layouts[0]
slide = prs.slides.add_slide(title_slide_layout)
title = slide.shapes.title
subtitle = slide.placeholders[1]
title.text = "Discovery Phase Epics"
subtitle.text = f"by credits"


# Add a slide for each epic
for epic in epics:
    slide_layout = prs.slide_layouts[1]  # Using Title and Content layout
    slide = prs.slides.add_slide(slide_layout)
    title = slide.shapes.title
    content = slide.placeholders[1]
    title.text = epic["title"]
    content.text = epic["content"]

# Add a conclusion slide at the end
conclusion_slide_layout = prs.slide_layouts[3]
slide = prs.slides.add_slide(conclusion_slide_layout)
title = slide.shapes.title
content = slide.placeholders[1]
title.text = "Conclusion"
content.text = ""

#Add next steps slide
next_steps_slide_layout = prs.slide_layouts[3]
slide = prs.slides.add_slide(next_steps_slide_layout)
title = slide.shapes.title
content = slide.placeholders[1]
title.text = "Next Steps"
text_frame = content.text_frame
for step in next_steps:
    p = text_frame.add_paragraph()
    p.text = step
    p.level = 0


# Save the presentation
current_directory = os.getcwd()
output_file_path = os.path.join(current_directory, presentation_name + ".pptx")
prs.save(output_file_path)
print(f"Presentation saved to output_file_path")

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=["Machine", "User"],
            value="Machine",
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name", display_name="Sender Name", info="Name of the sender.", value="AI", advanced=True
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id", display_name="Session ID", info="Session ID for the message.", advanced=True
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if self.session_id and isinstance(message, Message) and isinstance(message.text, str):
            self.store_message(message)
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"

    inputs = [
        MessageInput(name="input_value", display_name="Input"),

            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name", display_name="Model Name", advanced=False, options=MODEL_NAMES, value=MODEL_NAMES[0]
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="openai_api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        BoolInput(name="stream", display_name="Stream", info=STREAM_INFO_TEXT, advanced=True),
        StrInput(
            name="system_message",
            display_name="System Message",
            info="System message to pass to the model.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schea is a list of dictionarie s
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.openai_api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"

            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})  # type: ignore

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """

        Args:

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:

from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def post_code_processing(self, new_build_config: dict, current_build_config: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_build_config, current_build_config)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_build_config
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(frontend_template=frontend_node, raw_template=current_build_config["template"])
        return frontend_node

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=["Machine", "User"],
            value="Machine",
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name", display_name="Sender Name", info="Name of the sender.", value="AI", advanced=True
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id", display_name="Session ID", info="Session ID for the message.", advanced=True
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if self.session_id and isinstance(message, Message) and isinstance(message.text, str):
            self.store_message(message)
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

1.	Room Search and Browsing: Provide a system that allows users to search and browse available rooms based on preferences and dates.
2.	Room Booking and Customization: Give users the right to choose, allowing them to book rooms for specific dates, choose room types, and make special requests if they wish.
3.	Record Management: Develop a system to record and store room availability, user reservations, and detailed user information.
4.	Reservation Notifications: Ensure that users are sent informative notifications regarding their reservations in case of any adverse situation that may occur for their reservations (in case of any change or cancellation).
5.	Management Information: Let hotel managers see room occupancy and guest feedback through a panel.
6.	Payment Processing: Enable users to make payments for their reservations through the application.
7.	Administrative Control Panel: Provide system administrators with access to the panel to manage system settings and user accounts.
8.	Report Generation: Enable the system to generate comprehensive reports on room occupancy and guest satisfaction for analysis.
9.	Feedback Mechanism: Offer guests the option to send feedback after their stay at the hotel.
10.	Third-Party Integration Support: Ensure the system supports integration with third-party services to enhance functionality and features. 
11.	Reservation Change and Cancellation: Develop a system that allows users to change or cancel room reservations within a certain time frame, in accordance with the hotel's cancellation policies, increasing guest flexibility.
12.	Group Reservation Support: Simplify group bookings with the system, allowing users to book multiple rooms for events or conferences and simplifying the booking process for group organizers.
13.	Online Login: Ensure guests have the ability to check in online prior to their arrival, which will streamline the check-in process and help reduce wait times at the hotel front desk.
14.	Dynamic Pricing Management: Ensure hotel managers have the ability to set dynamic pricing based on factors such as demand, seasonal changes and other market conditions by optimizing their revenue management strategies.
15.	Local Area Information: Provide users with information about local attractions, restaurants, and transportation options near the hotel through the system, helping guests plan their itinerary and explore the surrounding area.

Im John Doe, the project manager here at the Software Firm.  Michael: Hi, Im Michael Green, the operations manager at the Market Firm.  Sarah: Hello, Im Sarah Black, the marketing director at the Market Firm.  Jane: Hi, Im Jane Smith, the lead developer.  Alice: Im Alice Johnson, the UX designer.  Bob: Hello, Im Bob Brown, the QA specialist.  Carol: Hi, Im Carol White, the marketing manager at the Software Firm.  Project Overview (15 minutes)  John: To kick things off, Michael and Sarah, could you provide an overview of your vision for the mobile application?  Michael: Sure, our goal is to create a user-friendly mobile app that enhances the shopping experience for our customers. We want features like easy product search, personalized recommendations, and a seamless checkout process.  Sarah: Additionally, we want to integrate loyalty programs and push notifications for promotions. Its important that the app reflects our brand and offers a modern, engaging experience.  John: That sounds great. Weve reviewed your initial requirements and have some ideas on how to implement these features effectively.  Development Approach (10 minutes)  John: Jane, could you outline our proposed development approach?  Jane: Absolutely. Well start with a discovery phase to fully understand the requirements and user personas. This will be followed by iterative development cycles where we build and test features incrementally. Well use agile methodologies to ensure flexibility and incorporate feedback promptly.  Michael: That sounds good. How do you handle any potential blockers or technical challenges?  Jane: Well have regular sprint reviews and retrospectives to identify and address issues quickly. Our team is experienced in resolving complex challenges, and well keep you informed throughout the process.  Design Considerations (10 minutes)  John: Alice, can you share our initial design thoughts?  Alice: Sure. Weve focused on creating an intuitive and visually appealing interface. The main screen will feature quick access to popular categories and personalized recommendations. Weve also designed a streamlined checkout process to minimize friction for the users.  Sarah: The designs look promising. Wed like to ensure that the app reflects our brands color scheme and style. Can we collaborate on this?  Alice: Absolutely. Well work closely with your team to ensure the design aligns with your branding guidelines. Well also conduct user testing to gather feedback and make necessary adjustments.  Quality Assurance (10 minutes)  John: Bob, whats our plan for quality assurance?  Bob: Well conduct comprehensive testing at each stage of development, including functionality, performance, and security testing. Our goal is to identify and fix any issues early to ensure a smooth user experience at launch.  Michael: Security is particularly important for us, especially concerning customer data. How will you handle this?  Bob: Well implement robust security measures, including encryption and secure authentication methods. Additionally, well perform regular security audits and penetration testing to identify and address vulnerabilities.  Marketing Strategy (10 minutes)  John: Carol, could you discuss how we can support the Market Firms marketing strategy for the app launch?  Carol: Certainly. We can assist with creating promotional materials and integrating analytics to track user engagement. Our team can also help with app store optimization to ensure the app reaches a wider audience.  Sarah: That sounds excellent. Wed like to plan a coordinated campaign across our digital channels. Can we schedule a meeting to discuss the specifics?  Carol: Absolutely, lets set up a time after this meeting to go over the details.  Action Items and Next Steps (5 minutes)  John: To recap, our action items are as follows: Jane and the development team will start the discovery phase, Alice will coordinate with Sarah on the design elements, Bob will outline the QA process, and Carol will plan the marketing strategy meeting. Does that cover everything?  Michael: Yes, thats comprehensive.  Sarah: Looks good to me.  Q&A and Open Discussion (5 minutes)  John: Any final questions or topics to discuss?  Michael: None from my side.  Sarah: I think were all set.  Jane: All good here.  Alice: No further comments.  Bob: Nothing more from me.  Carol: All set.  John: Great, thanks everyone. Our next meeting will be on July 4 at 10:00 AM. Meeting adjourned.  This format ensures clear communication and keeps the meeting focused and productive.

from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def post_code_processing(self, new_build_config: dict, current_build_config: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_build_config, current_build_config)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_build_config
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(frontend_template=frontend_node, raw_template=current_build_config["template"])
        return frontend_node

import operator
from functools import reduce

from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.constants import STREAM_INFO_TEXT
from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.base.models.openai_constants import MODEL_NAMES
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    MessageInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"

    inputs = [
        MessageInput(name="input_value", display_name="Input"),
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name", display_name="Model Name", advanced=False, options=MODEL_NAMES, value=MODEL_NAMES[0]
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="openai_api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        BoolInput(name="stream", display_name="Stream", info=STREAM_INFO_TEXT, advanced=True),
        StrInput(
            name="system_message",
            display_name="System Message",
            info="System message to pass to the model.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schea is a list of dictionarie s
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.openai_api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed
        model_kwargs["seed"] = seed

        if openai_api_key:
            api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key)
        else:
            api_key = None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature or 0.1,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})  # type: ignore

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return

Your job is to create python code that can be executed to create a presentation that will contain the appropriate data. Check the code below and fix to make sure that it will create a proper powerpoint presentation. Make sure that each epic is in its own slide, with the relevant user stories as the content. Remove any unnecessary lines in strings. If a part of the string is wrapped  in '**', remove the '**'. If a string has a bullet point included, remove the bullet point. Do not change the slide layouts.


from pptx import Presentation
from pptx.util import Inches
import os

# Add the list of epics for the discovery phase
presentation_name = {presentation_name}
conclusion_content = {conclusion_content}
epics = {epics}

#Next steps array
next_steps = {NextSteps}

#Credits
credits = "{credits}"

# Create a presentation object
prs = Presentation(r"C:\\Users\\sarim\\Desktop\\Globant\\PPTEST\\Themes\\GlobantTheme.pptx")


# Add a title slide
title_slide_layout = prs.slide_layouts[0]
slide = prs.slides.add_slide(title_slide_layout)
title = slide.shapes.title
subtitle = slide.placeholders[1]
title.text = "Discovery Phase Epics"
subtitle.text = f"by credits"


# Add a slide for each epic
for epic in epics:
    slide_layout = prs.slide_layouts[1]  # Using Title and Content layout
    slide = prs.slides.add_slide(slide_layout)
    title = slide.shapes.title
    content = slide.placeholders[1]
    title.text = epic["title"]
    content.text = epic["content"]

# Add a conclusion slide at the end
conclusion_slide_layout = prs.slide_layouts[3]
slide = prs.slides.add_slide(conclusion_slide_layout)
title = slide.shapes.title
content = slide.placeholders[1]
title.text = "Conclusion"
content.text = ""

#Add next steps slide
next_steps_slide_layout = prs.slide_layouts[3]
slide = prs.slides.add_slide(next_steps_slide_layout)
title = slide.shapes.title
content = slide.placeholders[1]
title.text = "Next Steps"
text_frame = content.text_frame
for step in next_steps:
    p = text_frame.add_paragraph()
    p.text = step
    p.level = 0


# Save the presentation
current_directory = os.getcwd()
output_file_path = os.path.join(current_directory, presentation_name + ".pptx")
prs.save(output_file_path)
print(f"Presentation saved to output_file_path")

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=["Machine", "User"],
            value="Machine",
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name", display_name="Sender Name", info="Name of the sender.", value="AI", advanced=True
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id", display_name="Session ID", info="Session ID for the message.", advanced=True
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if self.session_id and isinstance(message, Message) and isinstance(message.text, str):
            self.store_message(message)
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

import operator
from functools import reduce

from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.constants import STREAM_INFO_TEXT
from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.base.models.openai_constants import MODEL_NAMES
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    MessageInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"

    inputs = [
        MessageInput(name="input_value", display_name="Input"),
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name", display_name="Model Name", advanced=False, options=MODEL_NAMES, value=MODEL_NAMES[0]
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="openai_api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        BoolInput(name="stream", display_name="Stream", info=STREAM_INFO_TEXT, advanced=True),
        StrInput(
            name="system_message",
            display_name="System Message",
            info="System message to pass to the model.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schea is a list of dictionarie s
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.openai_api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed
        model_kwargs["seed"] = seed

        if openai_api_key:
            api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key)
        else:
            api_key = None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature or 0.1,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})  # type: ignore

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return

from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def post_code_processing(self, new_build_config: dict, current_build_config: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_build_config, current_build_config)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_build_config
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(frontend_template=frontend_node, raw_template=current_build_config["template"])
        return frontend_node

                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})  # type: ignore

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=["Machine", "User"],
            value="Machine",
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name", display_name="Sender Name", info="Name of the sender.", value="AI", advanced=True
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id", display_name="Session ID", info="Session ID for the message.", advanced=True
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if self.session_id and isinstance(message, Message) and isinstance(message.text, str):
            self.store_message(message)
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

1.	Room Search and Browsing: Provide a system that allows users to search and browse available rooms based on preferences and dates.
2.	Room Booking and Customization: Give users the right to choose, allowing them to book rooms for specific dates, choose room types, and make special requests if they wish.
3.	Record Management: Develop a system to record and store room availability, user reservations, and detailed user information.
4.	Reservation Notifications: Ensure that users are sent informative notifications regarding their reservations in case of any adverse situation that may occur for their reservations (in case of any change or cancellation).
5.	Management Information: Let hotel managers see room occupancy and guest feedback through a panel.
6.	Payment Processing: Enable users to make payments for their reservations through the application.
7.	Administrative Control Panel: Provide system administrators with access to the panel to manage system settings and user accounts.
8.	Report Generation: Enable the system to generate comprehensive reports on room occupancy and guest satisfaction for analysis.
9.	Feedback Mechanism: Offer guests the option to send feedback after their stay at the hotel.
10.	Third-Party Integration Support: Ensure the system supports integration with third-party services to enhance functionality and features. 
11.	Reservation Change and Cancellation: Develop a system that allows users to change or cancel room reservations within a certain time frame, in accordance with the hotel's cancellation policies, increasing guest flexibility.
12.	Group Reservation Support: Simplify group bookings with the system, allowing users to book multiple rooms for events or conferences and simplifying the booking process for group organizers.
13.	Online Login: Ensure guests have the ability to check in online prior to their arrival, which will streamline the check-in process and help reduce wait times at the hotel front desk.
14.	Dynamic Pricing Management: Ensure hotel managers have the ability to set dynamic pricing based on factors such as demand, seasonal changes and other market conditions by optimizing their revenue management strategies.
15.	Local Area Information: Provide users with information about local attractions, restaurants, and transportation options near the hotel through the system, helping guests plan their itinerary and explore the surrounding area.

Im John Doe, the project manager here at the Software Firm.  Michael: Hi, Im Michael Green, the operations manager at the Market Firm.  Sarah: Hello, Im Sarah Black, the marketing director at the Market Firm.  Jane: Hi, Im Jane Smith, the lead developer.  Alice: Im Alice Johnson, the UX designer.  Bob: Hello, Im Bob Brown, the QA specialist.  Carol: Hi, Im Carol White, the marketing manager at the Software Firm.  Project Overview (15 minutes)  John: To kick things off, Michael and Sarah, could you provide an overview of your vision for the mobile application?  Michael: Sure, our goal is to create a user-friendly mobile app that enhances the shopping experience for our customers. We want features like easy product search, personalized recommendations, and a seamless checkout process.  Sarah: Additionally, we want to integrate loyalty programs and push notifications for promotions. Its important that the app reflects our brand and offers a modern, engaging experience.  John: That sounds great. Weve reviewed your initial requirements and have some ideas on how to implement these features effectively.  Development Approach (10 minutes)  John: Jane, could you outline our proposed development approach?  Jane: Absolutely. Well start with a discovery phase to fully understand the requirements and user personas. This will be followed by iterative development cycles where we build and test features incrementally. Well use agile methodologies to ensure flexibility and incorporate feedback promptly.  Michael: That sounds good. How do you handle any potential blockers or technical challenges?  Jane: Well have regular sprint reviews and retrospectives to identify and address issues quickly. Our team is experienced in resolving complex challenges, and well keep you informed throughout the process.  Design Considerations (10 minutes)  John: Alice, can you share our initial design thoughts?  Alice: Sure. Weve focused on creating an intuitive and visually appealing interface. The main screen will feature quick access to popular categories and personalized recommendations. Weve also designed a streamlined checkout process to minimize friction for the users.  Sarah: The designs look promising. Wed like to ensure that the app reflects our brands color scheme and style. Can we collaborate on this?  Alice: Absolutely. Well work closely with your team to ensure the design aligns with your branding guidelines. Well also conduct user testing to gather feedback and make necessary adjustments.  Quality Assurance (10 minutes)  John: Bob, whats our plan for quality assurance?  Bob: Well conduct comprehensive testing at each stage of development, including functionality, performance, and security testing. Our goal is to identify and fix any issues early to ensure a smooth user experience at launch.  Michael: Security is particularly important for us, especially concerning customer data. How will you handle this?  Bob: Well implement robust security measures, including encryption and secure authentication methods. Additionally, well perform regular security audits and penetration testing to identify and address vulnerabilities.  Marketing Strategy (10 minutes)  John: Carol, could you discuss how we can support the Market Firms marketing strategy for the app launch?  Carol: Certainly. We can assist with creating promotional materials and integrating analytics to track user engagement. Our team can also help with app store optimization to ensure the app reaches a wider audience.  Sarah: That sounds excellent. Wed like to plan a coordinated campaign across our digital channels. Can we schedule a meeting to discuss the specifics?  Carol: Absolutely, lets set up a time after this meeting to go over the details.  Action Items and Next Steps (5 minutes)  John: To recap, our action items are as follows: Jane and the development team will start the discovery phase, Alice will coordinate with Sarah on the design elements, Bob will outline the QA process, and Carol will plan the marketing strategy meeting. Does that cover everything?  Michael: Yes, thats comprehensive.  Sarah: Looks good to me.  Q&A and Open Discussion (5 minutes)  John: Any final questions or topics to discuss?  Michael: None from my side.  Sarah: I think were all set.  Jane: All good here.  Alice: No further comments.  Bob: Nothing more from me.  Carol: All set.  John: Great, thanks everyone. Our next meeting will be on July 4 at 10:00 AM. Meeting adjourned.  This format ensures clear communication and keeps the meeting focused and productive.

from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def post_code_processing(self, new_build_config: dict, current_build_config: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_build_config, current_build_config)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_build_config
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(frontend_template=frontend_node, raw_template=current_build_config["template"])
        return frontend_node
